translation: Hrishikesha blew the Panchajanya, Arjuna blew the Devadatta, and Bhima, the wolf-bellied doer of terrible deeds, blew the great conch Paundra.
commentary: 1.15 Panchajanya (the conch named) Panchajanya? Hrishikesha (the Lord of the senses) Krishna? Devadatta (the conch named) Devadatta? Dhananjaya (the victor of wealth) Arjuna? Poundra (the conch named) Poundra? Dadhmau blew? great conch great conch? Bhimkarma doer of terrible dees? Bhima (having the belly of a wolf) Bhima.No Commentary.
